title: Repeated Full computer crash - Please help
body:
I have been playing League since season 1, and I have never had an issue with the game running on my computers - first my old Vista computer, and now my current tower that can run Guild Wars 2 and Overwatch on maximum settings.

But around November 2015, I started having issues where the game would completely crash my computer and force a complete restart mid-game. Sometimes it happened right at the start, sometimes midway through, and a couple times at the end.

I'm far from the only one who's had this issue, and there have been a lot of suggestions on different sites to try and fix it, but none of it has worked for me. I've cleaned my computer repeatedly. I've lowered the graphics to minimum, back to maximum, and am currently somewhere in the middle. I've updated all drivers. I've run repairs and reinstalled the game multiple times, most recently about a month ago. And nothing has prevented the crashes from coming back, or even changed their frequency.

If anyone knows a fix for this, please share it. I still very much enjoy League and love maining support, but the more times this crash happens the less I want to risk another match.

replies.body:
Crash happened again.  Forced computer shutdown, randomly in the middle of the game.

This time I've checked my graphics updates, clean-reinstalled League, and downloaded/installed .net framework 3.5. I've also done a factory defaults for my graphics, though it didn't appear to do anything.  We'll see if this continues.

Full computer crashes or system lockups are often a sign there's something going wrong with either your hardware or drivers. While you may need to reach out to our tech team for them to run through some diagnostic tests, a good place to start is our [Crashing guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes). 

Let me know if you notice any change after going through those steps.

Turns out AMD had a few updates since the last time I checked.  I've also run the League repair again, defragmented my hard drive, and cleaned up a lot of TEMP files.  I've also made sure DirectX debug is not running.

It's been 3 days since those updates, and no crashes yet.  I'll keep this page posted if I encounter any more and the other Crash Guide steps I take if it does.
